US News & World Report: [What Is an Open Convention and Why Do Some Democrats Want One?](https://www.usnews.com/news/national-news/articles/2024-06-28/what-is-an-open-convention-and-why-do-some-democrats-want-one)
Wikipedia: [Brokered convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brokered_convention)
The Atlantic: [The Biden-Replacement Operation](https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2024/06/great-democratic-conundrum-biden/678830/)

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on the historical rarity of brokered conventions in the modern primary system and without specific information suggesting a highly contested nomination process, the likelihood of a brokered convention seems low. However, the presence of multiple strong candidates could increase this likelihood.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
[Verisign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Verisign) operates the authoritative registry for the .com generic top-level domain (TLD) under a registry agreement with the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN) and a [Cooperative Agreement](https://www.ntia.gov/page/verisign-cooperative-agreement) with the US Department of Commerce (DOC). This means it is the wholesale provider of the .com TLD to every domain name registrar. The American Economic Liberties Projected [has called](https://www.economicliberties.us/press-release/ntia-and-doj-must-break-verisigns-monopoly-power-over-domain-names-advocates-urge/) this arrangement a "government-designated monopoly over domain registration." According to [The American Prospect](https://prospect.org/power/2024-06-27-government-created-most-profitable-company-verisign/):

>You have probably never heard of the most profitable company in America, and possibly the world. It’s a government-granted monopoly that feasts on high margins for a low-dollar administrative product. Today, three advocacy groups pressured the Biden administration to take down the rules in place that enable this gravy train.

>The company is called VeriSign [*sic*], and it has exclusive control of the registration system for the .com domain name. Every year, hundreds of millions of website owners pay VeriSign [*sic*] a small annual fee to keep their .com in working order. Every year, the cost of managing the database to make sure that .com websites work either stays flat or goes down, while the fee for registering a .com website goes up.

The Cooperative Agreement between Verisign and the US DOC will automatically renew for a six-year term unless the DOC provides notice of non-renewal on August 2, 2024.

According to [Bloomberg](https://archive.ph/IXZ3V#selection-1705.0-1726.0), during the 2018 renewal the Trump Administration lifted the cap on wholesale prices for *.com*. The antitrust advocacy groups have written to the Justice Department to withdraw guidance that allowed the elimination of price caps in the 2018 renewal, with the letters citing President Biden’s 2021 [executive order](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/presidential-actions/2021/07/09/executive-order-on-promoting-competition-in-the-american-economy/) on competition.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on the historical context, the typical process for renewals and amendments, the conditions necessary for termination, and the timeframe required for significant changes to such agreements, it is unlikely that the US government would end its agreement with Verisign before August 3, 2024.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

metadata.background_info:
**Deadpool & Wolverine** is an upcoming blockbuster by Marvel Studios scheduled to be released on July 26, 2024 featuring the two iconic heroes from the X-Men Universe.

The recent projection from Deadline puts the domestic opening to [$160-$165 million](https://deadline.com/2024/07/deadpool-wolverine-box-office-opening-projection-1236000799/), which would not only be the best opening year-to-date (beating **Inside Out 2** with $154 million) but also a record start for an R-rated movie. 

Another projection from June was even higher, [at $200+ million](https://deadline.com/2024/06/deadpool-wolverine-box-office-projection-1235973545/).

The ticket seller Fandango [reported on May 21](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/deadpool-and-wolverine-has-strongest-day-one-ticket-pre-sales-in-franchise-history-at-fandango/1100-6523599/) that their ticket pre-sales for the movie were the site's biggest ones in 2024 up to date.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, let's break down the key components and analyze them step by step. 1. Understanding the Movies Involved: - Deadpool (2016): This was a groundbreaking film for its R-rated humor, unique storytelling, and the popularity of the Deadpool character, played by Ryan Reynolds. It had a surprisingly successful opening weekend, which contributed to its overall domestic box office success. - The Wolverine (2013): This film, starring Hugh Jackman, is part of the X-Men film series and focuses on Wolverine's character. While it did well at the box office, its domestic opening was not as strong as some of the other films in the X-Men franchise. - Deadpool & Wolverine: This upcoming film combines two of the most popular characters from the X-Men universe. The success of this film hinges on the popularity of these characters, the storyline, marketing, and how well it resonates with both old and new audiences. 2. Box Office Trends and Predictions: - The success of superhero movies has generally been on an upward trend, with many recent films breaking box office records. However, the landscape is also highly competitive, with audience preferences shifting towards streaming services and the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic still being felt. - The combination of Deadpool and Wolverine could attract a broad audience, given their individual fan bases and the potential for a compelling narrative that leverages their contrasting characters. 3. Marketing and Release Timing: - The marketing campaign for 'Deadpool & Wolverine' will play a crucial role in generating buzz and attracting viewers. Given the popularity of the characters, a well-executed campaign could significantly boost the film's opening weekend. - The release date and competition around that time will also be factors. A release during a less crowded period could help the film achieve a higher opening weekend. 4. Historical Context and Combined Opening: - The combined domestic opening of 'Deadpool' and 'The Wolverine' is $185,548,391. For 'Deadpool & Wolverine' to surpass this, it needs to generate significant interest and positive reviews to ensure a strong opening weekend. Given these considerations, the potential for 'Deadpool & Wolverine' to have a higher domestic box office opening than the combined openings of 'Deadpool' and 'The Wolverine' seems plausible, especially considering the popularity of the characters and the general trend of superhero movies performing well at the box office. However, the competitive landscape, marketing efforts, and audience reception will ultimately determine its success.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

metadata.background_info:
Since late 2022, Nvidia Corporation has experienced nearly 10x growth in market capitalization, driven by its [dominance in the AI chip market](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/nvidias-ai-chip-dominance-continue-210200974.html). Nvidia's GPUs are critical in the development of large language models, and are highly sought after by major tech companies like OpenAI, Microsoft, Amazon, and Alphabet.

On May 22nd, Nvidia released [impressive Q1 financial results](https://nvidianews.nvidia.com/news/nvidia-announces-financial-results-for-first-quarter-fiscal-2025#:~:text=NVIDIA%20(NASDAQ%3A%20NVDA)%20today,262%25%20from%20a%20year%20ago.) and simultaneously announced a 10:1 stock split and increase to its dividend, sending its stock price to new all-time highs.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of Nvidia's market capitalization being larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, we need to consider the current market trends, the companies' financial health, and any potential factors that could significantly impact their market capitalization in the given timeframe. As of my last update, Nvidia has been experiencing significant growth, largely due to its dominance in the graphics processing unit (GPU) market and its advancements in artificial intelligence (AI) and high-performance computing. Apple, on the other hand, has a diversified product line and a strong brand presence but faces challenges such as market saturation in the smartphone segment and increasing competition in the tech industry. However, considering the short timeframe (from July 8, 2024, to July 17, 2024), significant shifts in market capitalization that would result in Nvidia surpassing Apple are unlikely without major events or announcements that dramatically change the market's perception of either company. Such events could include unexpected breakthroughs, major product releases, significant financial announcements, or regulatory changes that specifically benefit Nvidia or harm Apple. Given the short period and the significant gap that Nvidia would need to close to surpass Apple's market capitalization, it seems improbable without such a catalyst. Moreover, predicting such events with certainty is challenging, and thus, the probability leans towards a lower estimate.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

metadata.background_info: According to [FRED](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS): > Chicago Board Options Exchange, CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index [VXVCLS], retrieved from FRED, Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) being higher year-over-year on July 20, 2024, we need to consider several factors that influence volatility indices. question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

metadata.background_info:
After a far-right victory in the European elections, French President Emmanuel Macron dissolved the National Assembly, calling snap elections for June 30th and July 7th.

The majority of the 577 districts will [see a runoff](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/french-election-run-off-how-does-it-work-what-look-out-2024-07-05/) on Sunday, July 7, with the most common set of qualified parties being the National Rally-led Union of the Far-Right, centrist Together, and left and center-left New Popular Front. The unprecedented number of three-way runoffs (including *four*-ways in five districts) was boosted by strong turnout, [nearly 20 percentage points more than in 2022](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/strong-turnout-france-high-stakes-elections-support-far-right-grows/); but Together and the NPF guided their third-placed candidates to withdraw to improve the other's chances to beat the far-right, mostly represented by Marine Le Pen's National Rally.

Once the runoff numbers are known for the 17th National Assembly, the question becomes: who will be Prime Minister? The French semi-presidential system gives President Macron political responsibilities, in particular in foreign policy, regardless of the makeup of Parliament; but he must also nominate a Prime Minister, who conducts domestic policy. The government does not need a positive confidence vote from legislators, but it could be subject to a vote of no confidence; current Prime Minister Gabriel Attal's minority government has been relying on case-by-case deals to get legislation approved.

While the far-right has already elected 38 Deputies and made it to the runoff almost everywhere, its surge might still be forestalled by the strategic pact between the center and the left.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on the current political landscape in France and the influence of the 'Together' coalition, it is reasonable to expect continuity in the party affiliation of the Prime Minister up to July 2024, barring significant unforeseen changes.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on the current political landscape in France, the resilience of Macron's presidency, and the improbability of the scenarios that could lead to a change in the coalition of the Prime Minister by the specified date, it is reasonable to conclude that the likelihood of the Prime Minister belonging to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, is low.

question.title: Will Tadej Pogačar win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.background_info:
The [Tour de France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Tour_de_France) is an annual men's multiple stage bicycle race primarily held in France, while also occasionally passing through nearby countries. It is the most prestigious and most difficult bicycle race in the world. The [2024 edition of the race](https://www.letour.fr/en/overall-route) started on June 29 in Florence, Italy, and will end in Nice, France on July 21.

Historical data, current form, and team support should be considered when making a prediction. Please note  also that unexpected events, such as accidents or disqualifications, may affect the outcome of the race.

For more information please see:

[New York Times What to Know About This Year’s Tour de France (Which Begins in Italy)](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/27/sports/cycling/tour-de-france-preview.html)

Past Performance: Tadej Pogačar has already demonstrated his capability to win the Tour de France, having done so in 2020 and 2021. His past victories indicate a strong potential for future success. 2. Current Form: As of the last update, Pogačar's form in the 2024 season would be crucial. Assuming he has maintained a high level of performance and hasn't suffered from significant injuries or setbacks, this would positively impact his chances. 3. Team Support: The strength and support of his team, UAE Team Emirates, play a significant role. A strong team can provide essential strategic and physical support during the race, enhancing his chances of winning. 4. Competition: The level of competition, including other top contenders like Jonas Vingegaard, Primoz Roglic, and Egan Bernal, affects Pogačar's chances. The strategies and form of these competitors in the 2024 season would influence the race's dynamics. 5. Course Suitability: The 2024 Tour de France route and whether it suits Pogačar's strengths more than his competitors also need to be considered. A route with more time trials or mountain stages could favor certain riders over others. Given these factors and assuming Pogačar enters the race in good form, with strong team support, and the course layout somewhat in his favor, it would be reasonable to consider him a top contender for the win. However, without specific details on his current form, team dynamics, and the exact route of the 2024 Tour de France as of my last update, it's challenging to assign a very high probability. Considering the inherent uncertainties in sports competitions, including the potential for accidents or unexpected health issues, a cautious approach is warranted. Therefore, while acknowledging Pogačar's significant potential and past successes, a balanced probability estimate considering both his strengths and the uncertainties involved would be around 0.35. This reflects a positive outlook on his chances while also accounting for the unpredictable nature of the event and the strong competition he faces.

question.title: Will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.background_info:
The Kalenjin people, native to Kenya, [dominate racing in distances between 800m and the marathon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kalenjin_people#Sport).  It is estimated that 40% of the top honours available to men in international athletics at these distances (Olympic medals, World Championships medals, and World Cross Country Championships honours) have been earned by Kalenjin runners, in spite of the ethnicity representing less than 0.1% of the human population.

Will they win both the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

question.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
Brazilian pole vaulter Thiago Braz set the Olympic record for the men's pole vault at 6.03m at the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympics. Since then, the world record [has risen to 6.24m](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Men%27s_pole_vault_world_record_progression), set by Swedish athlete Armand Duplantis earlier in 2024. In 2020, his only chance so far to break the Olympic record, the Swede did succeed at his 6.19m WR attempt, though he had already won gold with 6.02m.

With Braz suspended from the current Games on account of doping, will his record be broken by the dominant world record holder, or maybe by another competitor?

The men's pole vault [is scheduled](https://olympics.com/en/paris-2024/schedule/athletics/men-s-pole-vault?day=3-august) to begin August 3, 2024.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of the Olympic record for the men's pole vault being broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, let's consider several factors: 1. Current Record and Progression: The current Olympic record for the men's pole vault is 6.03m, set by Thiago Braz of Brazil at the 2016 Rio Olympics. The progression of the record over the years shows a trend of gradual improvement, but with significant jumps at times. The world record is slightly higher, at 6.21m, set by Sergey Bubka of Ukraine in 1994, which is also the current world record. 2. Recent Performances: In recent years, several athletes have approached or cleared heights close to the Olympic record. For instance, Sam Kendricks of the United States and Armand Duplantis of Sweden have been among the top performers, consistently clearing heights over 6.00m. Duplantis, in particular, has shown incredible form, setting multiple records indoors and outdoors, including the world record in 2020. 3. Athlete Form and Competition: The form of top athletes going into the Olympics is crucial. Injuries, training, and recent competition performances can all impact an athlete's ability to break a record. Given the competitive nature of the event, a strong rivalry could push athletes to new heights. 4. Environmental and External Factors: Weather conditions, the quality of the pole vaulting equipment, and the athletic surface can all affect performance. The Paris Olympics will be held in the summer, and while weather conditions can be unpredictable, the equipment and surface are expected to be of the highest standard. 5. Historical Context of Record Breaking: Records are often broken in the Olympics due to the high level of competition and the peak condition of athletes. The men's pole vault has seen records broken in the past Olympics, indicating that the event is ripe for further progression. Considering these factors, there is a strong possibility that the Olympic record for the men's pole vault could be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, especially given the current form of athletes like Armand Duplantis and the historical context of record-breaking in the event.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.background_info:
[Gold medal wins at the Summer Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All-time_Olympic_Games_medal_table) are concentrated in a small number of countries; the United States alone has won nearly 20% of every gold medal ever awarded, and a total of eight countries account for the majority of medalists.

Conversely, prior to the opening of the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, there are over 100 National Olympic Committees that have never won a gold medal. In recent Games, the number of countries that won their first gold were:

* London 2012: 3
* Rio de Janeiro 2016: 9
* Tokyo 2020: 3

Will this number be 5 or more this year?

metadata.chain_of_thought: The combination of broad global participation, the spread of athletic talent, the introduction of new Olympic sports, and historical trends of new countries achieving their first gold medals all contribute to a positive outlook for at least 5 countries winning their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.background_info:
[Medal wins at the Summer Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All-time_Olympic_Games_medal_table) are concentrated in a fairly small number of countries; the United States alone has won about 1 out of every 6 medals ever awarded, and a total of ten countries account for the majority of medalists.

Conversely, prior to the opening of the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, there are about 60 National Olympic Committees that have never won a gold medal; the most recent countries to win their first medal, in the Tokyo 2020 Games, were Burkina Faso, San Marino and Turkmenistan.

Will at least 5 new countries win their first medal at the current Games?

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on the factors of historical context, introduction of new sports, globalization of sports development, high competition level, and a general statistical analysis, there's a reasonable expectation for at least 5 countries to win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.background_info:
On June 27, 2024, Joe Biden and Donald Trump held their first debate as part of the campaign for the 2024 presidential election. Biden's debate performance was [widely seen as poor](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-trump-june-debate-poll/), and prompted calls for Biden to drop out, including [from the New York Times editorial board](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/28/opinion/biden-election-debate-trump.html) and, as of July 5, [three House Democrats](https://thehill.com/homenews/house/4755497-seth-moulton-biden-presidential-race/).

The Biden team has reportedly been [taking action](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/04/politics/biden-rising-tide-pressure-reelection-bid-analysis/index.html) to reverse recent perceptions, and has [so far insisted](https://thehill.com/homenews/campaign/4754840-biden-campaign-denies-dropout-rumors/) that Biden will not be dropping out. However, the New York Times [reported](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/07/03/us/politics/biden-withdraw-election-debate.html) that the Biden team has internally acknowledged that they must turn perceptions around quickly.

According to [538's presidential polling average](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) (when accessed on July 5, 2024), on the date of the debate Trump held a +0.2 percentage point lead in the polling averages, which has since widened to a +2.4 percentage point lead for Trump reported for July 5. The near-term polling trend may be critical as Biden weighs whether to stay in the race ahead of the [2024 Democratic National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Democratic_National_Convention), which is scheduled to be held August 19th through the 22nd.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on the current lead of 2.4 points and considering the potential for minor fluctuations in polling averages over short periods without major influencing events, the probability is slightly above a pure guess but acknowledges the inherent volatility and uncertainty in polling data.

The Biden team has reportedly been [taking action](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/04/politics/biden-rising-tide-pressure-reelection-bid-analysis/index.html) to reverse recent perceptions, and has [so far insisted](https://thehill.com/homenews/campaign/4754840-biden-campaign-denies-dropout-rumors/) that Biden will not be dropping out. However, the New York Times [reported](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/07/03/us/politics/biden-withdraw-election-debate.html) that the Biden team has internally acknowledged that they must turn perceptions around quickly.

According to [538's presidential polling average](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) (when accessed on July 5, 2024), on the date of the debate Trump held a +0.2 percentage point lead in the polling averages, which has since widened to a +2.4 percentage point lead for Trump reported for July 5. The near-term polling trend may be critical as Biden weighs whether to stay in the race ahead of the [2024 Democratic National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Democratic_National_Convention), which is scheduled to be held August 19th through the 22nd.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on the current lead and considering the short time frame but also the inherent volatility of polls, it seems plausible that Trump's lead could remain within the specified range, but there's always a chance for unexpected shifts.

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if the winning time of the men's 100m race is less than 9.63s.

metadata.background_info: Usain Bolt's 9.63s Olympic record has stood since the 2012 London Olympics. Will it be broken in Paris 2024?

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of the men's 100m dash winning time breaking the Olympic record of 9.63s at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, let's consider several factors: 1. Historical Progression: The Olympic record in the men's 100m dash has progressively improved over the years, but at a slowing rate. The current record of 9.63s, set by Usain Bolt in 2012, has stood for over a decade, indicating that further improvements are becoming increasingly difficult. 2. Current Athlete Performance: As of the last available data before the creation of this question, the world's top sprinters have been performing close to, but not significantly under, the 9.63s mark. The emergence of new talent is always a possibility, but the gap to bridge to break the record is quite narrow. 3. Technological and Training Advancements: Advances in training methods, technology (such as shoe technology), and sports science could potentially lead to improvements in performance. However, these factors have already been heavily optimized, and any further gains are likely to be marginal. 4. Environmental Factors: The conditions in Paris during the Olympics, including temperature, humidity, and wind, could affect the performance. Optimal conditions could potentially shave off a few milliseconds, but significantly breaking the record would likely require more than just favorable conditions. 5. Psychological Factors: The mental state of athletes can significantly impact their performance. The pressure of the Olympic stage can either hinder or enhance performance, but predicting this impact is challenging. Considering these factors, while it's possible for the Olympic record to be broken given the right combination of athlete talent, technological advancements, and environmental conditions, the likelihood seems relatively low given the narrow margin for improvement and the long-standing nature of the current record.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

metadata.background_info:
As per the Olympic Committee’s [recommendations](https://olympics.com/ioc/news/strict-eligibility-conditions-in-place-as-ioc-eb-approves-individual-neutral-athletes-ains-for-the-olympic-games-paris-2024) from earlier this year, Russian and Belarusian athletes will be allowed to participate in the 2024 Games as long as they do so as so-called "Individual Neutral Athletes" (AINs), without an accompanying national flag or anthem.

The Russian Federation/Russian Olympic Committee has won an average of 19 gold medals in the last 3 Olympic Games, and Belarus has averaged  1.7.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Considering the factors mentioned above, it seems unlikely that Individual Neutral Athletes will win ≥15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, given the tough competition and historical medal distribution. However, without exact information on the number of participating athletes, it's difficult to make a precise estimate.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

metadata.background_info:
The [Bombay Stock Exchange Sensitive Index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BSE_SENSEX), also known as the S&P BSE SENSEX or simply the SENSEX, is a stock market index consisting of 30 of the largest companies listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange. It is one of the oldest and most widely followed equity indices in India. The SENSEX is intended to reflect the overall performance of the Indian stock market.

India's recent general elections saw incumbent Prime Minister Narendra Modi's party, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), win a [narrower victory](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/india-election-modi-bjp-lost-majority-election-surprise-rcna155557) than expected, raising concerns about potential policy paralysis and the ability of the government to implement key economic reforms. As a result, in the immediate aftermath of the elections, the SENSEX has experienced significant volatility, beginning with a [drop of almost 6%](https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2024/6/5/india-election-why-modis-narrow-win-has-the-stock-market-in-a-spin) on June 4th, followed by a significant bounce on June 5th.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of the BSE SENSEX closing value being greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k on July 21, 2024, we need to consider a few factors: 1. Historical Volatility: The historical volatility of the BSE SENSEX gives us an idea of how much the index can fluctuate. Although the prompt does not provide specific historical data, the SENSEX has shown significant volatility over the years, influenced by global and domestic economic factors. 2. Market Trends: Understanding the current market trends leading up to July 21, 2024, is crucial. Markets can be influenced by various factors including economic indicators, government policies, and geopolitical events. Without current data, it's difficult to assess the exact trend but typically, markets oscillate within certain ranges unless significant events occur. 3. Economic Indicators: Economic indicators such as inflation rates, GDP growth, and interest rates set by the Reserve Bank of India can significantly impact market performance. Positive economic indicators can boost the market, while negative indicators can drag it down. 4. Global Market Influence: The global economy, particularly the performance of key economies like the US and China, can influence Indian markets. Global economic trends and significant events in these countries can have a ripple effect on the BSE SENSEX. 5. Random Events: Finally, random and unforeseen events, such as natural disasters or sudden political changes, can have unpredictable impacts on the market. Given these considerations and without access to the most current data and specific trends leading up to the date in question, a precise prediction is challenging. However, considering the volatility of the market and assuming no drastic events that would significantly skew the market from its historical trends, it's reasonable to expect fluctuations within a certain range. The range of greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k seems like a narrow but plausible window, especially if the market is stable and no major economic shifts occur.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

metadata.background_info:
In May 2024, sunspot region AR3664, now designated as AR3697, returned to face Earth after merging with another active sunspot region, resulting in numerous M- and X-class solar flares that caused intense [geomagnetic storms and auroras](https://earthsky.org/earth/auroras-last-night-extreme-solar-storm-wow-millions-may-10-11-12-2024/) visible at unusually low latitudes. 

As AR3697 [returns to face Earth](https://www.space.com/return-aurora-causing-sunspot-june-solar-storm-prospects) in early June 2024, space weather forecasters anticipate ongoing geomagnetic activity and are closely monitoring the region's continued potential to produce extreme space weather. 

[Sunspots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunspot) are areas of intense magnetic activity that often give rise to solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which can disturb Earth's magnetosphere and impact satellite operations, power grids, and navigation systems.

The [K-index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-index), which measures fluctuations in Earth's magnetic field, ranges from from 0 to 9. The NOAA Space Weather Scales uses the Kp values to classify the severity of geomagnetic storms from G1 (minor) to G5 (extreme), equating to Kp values of 5 to 9, respectively.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Given the variability in solar activity and the inherent difficulty in predicting geomagnetic storms, there's a moderate chance that a geomagnetic storm with a Kp index greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6 could occur within a two-week window, considering the general frequency of such events.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

metadata.background_info: A few Olympic sports - swimming, athletics, gymnastics - have athletes competing in multiple events. Will the athlete winning the most gold medals at the 2024 Games in Paris be someone competing in the swimming events?

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of a swimmer winning the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, let's break down the reasoning into several key points: 1. Historical Performance of Swimmers: Historically, swimmers have been among the top medal winners at the Olympics. Swimmers like Michael Phelps, who holds the record for the most gold medals won by an individual in Olympic history, demonstrate the potential for high medal counts in swimming events. 2. Number of Events: Swimming offers a large number of events, which increases the potential for athletes in this sport to win multiple medals. With events in various strokes and distances, both individually and in relays, swimmers have more opportunities to compete and win medals compared to athletes in sports with fewer events. 3. Competition Level: The level of competition in swimming is extremely high, with talented athletes from around the world competing in each event. However, the same can be said for other sports, such as track and field, gymnastics, and cycling, which also have a high level of competition and multiple events. 4. Emerging Talent: Each Olympic cycle brings new talent to the forefront. The prediction of a swimmer winning the most gold medals would be bolstered if there is a known emerging talent in swimming who is expected to dominate their events. 5. Performance in Other Sports: Other sports, such as track and field, have athletes who compete in multiple events (e.g., sprinters who participate in both the 100m and 200m races, as well as relay events). These athletes also have the potential to win multiple gold medals. 6. Relay Events: Swimming has a strong team component with relay events, which can significantly increase a swimmer's medal count. However, relay events are also present in other sports, offering similar opportunities for athletes in those disciplines. Considering these points, while swimmers have historically performed well and have many opportunities to win medals, the presence of talented athletes in other sports with multiple events means that the competition for the most gold medals is not limited to swimming. However, given the historical dominance of swimmers and the structure of swimming events, it's reasonable to consider that a swimmer could win the most gold medals.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
[Verisign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Verisign) operates the authoritative registry for the .com generic top-level domain (TLD) under a registry agreement with the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN) and a [Cooperative Agreement](https://www.ntia.gov/page/verisign-cooperative-agreement) with the US Department of Commerce (DOC). This means it is the wholesale provider of the .com TLD to every domain name registrar. The American Economic Liberties Projected [has called](https://www.economicliberties.us/press-release/ntia-and-doj-must-break-verisigns-monopoly-power-over-domain-names-advocates-urge/) this arrangement a "government-designated monopoly over domain registration." According to [The American Prospect](https://prospect.org/power/2024-06-27-government-created-most-profitable-company-verisign/):

>You have probably never heard of the most profitable company in America, and possibly the world. It’s a government-granted monopoly that feasts on high margins for a low-dollar administrative product. Today, three advocacy groups pressured the Biden administration to take down the rules in place that enable this gravy train.

>The company is called VeriSign [*sic*], and it has exclusive control of the registration system for the .com domain name. Every year, hundreds of millions of website owners pay VeriSign [*sic*] a small annual fee to keep their .com in working order. Every year, the cost of managing the database to make sure that .com websites work either stays flat or goes down, while the fee for registering a .com website goes up.

The Cooperative Agreement between Verisign and the US DOC will automatically renew for a six-year term unless the DOC provides notice of non-renewal on August 2, 2024.

According to [Bloomberg](https://archive.ph/IXZ3V#selection-1705.0-1726.0), during the 2018 renewal the Trump Administration lifted the cap on wholesale prices for *.com*. The antitrust advocacy groups have written to the Justice Department to withdraw guidance that allowed the elimination of price caps in the 2018 renewal, with the letters citing President Biden’s 2021 [executive order](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/presidential-actions/2021/07/09/executive-order-on-promoting-competition-in-the-american-economy/) on competition.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The historical pattern of extensions, the lack of specific information on the current administration's stance on this issue, and the absence of recent statements from the DOC or Verisign indicating a desire to end the agreement suggest that termination before August 3, 2024, is unlikely.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

metadata.background_info:
**Deadpool & Wolverine** is an upcoming blockbuster by Marvel Studios scheduled to be released on July 26, 2024 featuring the two iconic heroes from the X-Men Universe.

The recent projection from Deadline puts the domestic opening to [$160-$165 million](https://deadline.com/2024/07/deadpool-wolverine-box-office-opening-projection-1236000799/), which would not only be the best opening year-to-date (beating **Inside Out 2** with $154 million) but also a record start for an R-rated movie. 

Another projection from June was even higher, [at $200+ million](https://deadline.com/2024/06/deadpool-wolverine-box-office-projection-1235973545/).

The ticket seller Fandango [reported on May 21](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/deadpool-and-wolverine-has-strongest-day-one-ticket-pre-sales-in-franchise-history-at-fandango/1100-6523599/) that their ticket pre-sales for the movie were the site's biggest ones in 2024 up to date.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Based on the popularity of the characters involved, the trend of superhero movies performing well at the box office, and the anticipation for their team-up, it is reasonable to expect a strong opening for 'Deadpool & Wolverine.'

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

metadata.background_info:
Although most events in the Summer Olympics are contested by individual athletes, or small teams of 2-4, a few have one single larger team representing their entire country. These are:

Association football
Basketball 5×5
Basketball 3×3
Field hockey
Handball
Rugby sevens
Volleyball
Water polo

(Beach volleyball is listed on the source but excluded from the question because two teams from each team can qualify, unlike the other sports.)

Will the women's teams of the same nation win at least two of these sports?

metadata.chain_of_thought: To determine the probability of the same nation winning more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, we need to consider the competitiveness and historical performance of various nations across the eight team sports mentioned: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Historically, a few nations have shown dominance in multiple team sports. For instance, the United States has a strong record in basketball, both in the 3×3 and 5×5 formats, and has also performed well in volleyball and water polo. Similarly, nations like Australia and Great Britain have shown competitiveness across multiple sports, including field hockey, rugby sevens, and to a lesser extent, in basketball and volleyball. However, the increasing global competitiveness in women's sports and the introduction of new events like 3×3 basketball, which might attract different nations' strengths, could lead to a more diverse distribution of gold medals. The question of whether the same NOC will win at least two of these events also depends on factors like team dynamics, player injuries, and the specific competition format at the 2024 Olympics. Given these considerations, while there is a historical precedent for some nations to excel in multiple team sports, the increasing global competition and specialization in specific sports could lead to a scenario where no single nation dominates more than one sport. However, considering the traditional strengths of certain nations in multiple sports, it's reasonable to estimate a moderate probability that at least one nation will win more than one gold medal in the women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

metadata.background_info: Tennis at the Olympics has five events: singles for men and women, and doubles for men, women and mixed. This makes it possible for the same athlete to win more than one medal. Will it happen?

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of an athlete winning more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, let's break down the factors involved: 1. Historical Context: It's common for top tennis players to participate in multiple events at the Olympics, such as singles and doubles (including mixed doubles). Historically, several players have won multiple medals in tennis at the Olympics. For example, the Williams sisters, Venus and Serena, have both achieved this feat in the past. 2. Competition Format: The Olympic tennis tournament typically includes singles and doubles events for both men and women, as well as a mixed doubles event. This provides multiple avenues for athletes to win medals. 3. Player Participation: Top-ranked players often choose to participate in both singles and doubles to maximize their medal chances. The decision to participate in multiple events can significantly increase an athlete's chances of winning more than one medal. 4. Skill and Dominance: The tennis world has seen periods of dominance by top players. Athletes like Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal, and the aforementioned Williams sisters have shown the capability to win multiple titles in a short span, including at the Olympics. 5. Injury and Fatigue: The compact schedule of the Olympics can lead to concerns about player fatigue and injury, especially for those competing in multiple events. However, top players often have the physical conditioning and support teams to manage these challenges effectively. Considering these factors, the likelihood of at least one athlete winning more than one medal in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics is relatively high. The combination of historical precedent, the opportunity to compete in multiple events, and the presence of dominant players in the sport supports this assessment.

question.title: Will Poland win the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship?
question.body: This question will resolve Yes if Poland is the winner of the WTC 2024 as announced on the official site or the official social media of the organisation.

metadata.background_info:
Warhammer 40,000 is a miniature wargame produced by Games Workshop. Set in the far future, players collect, assemble, and paint miniature figures representing warriors, creatures, and vehicles from various factions. Players then pit their armies against each other on a tabletop battlefield. Warhammer 40,000 is currently the [most popular](https://icv2.com/print/article/56556) miniature wargame in the world.

Each year, the World Team Championship (WTC) is organized, where 8-player teams from around the world compete against each other. The teams are separated into 4 seeding groups based on past performance. In the group stage of the tournament, 10 groups are formed with 4 teams each (one from each seeding group). Group stage performance determines the overall ranking among teams, which then compete in a further 4 games following a [Swiss format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swiss-system_tournament). The team with the most total points from the group and Swiss stages is crowned the winner.

This year, the WTC takes place in Mechelen, Belgium from August 8th to 11th. 40 national teams are competing, including 5 first-time competitors: Andorra, China, Mexico, Singapore/Thailand, and South Korea. The full list of teams and seeding groups can be found [here](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=847246644093139). Past performance can be found [here](https://worldteamchampionship.com/about/history/).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of Poland winning the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship, several factors need to be considered, including the team's past performance, the strength of the competition, and any changes to the team or the game's meta that could impact their chances. 1. Past Performance: Poland's performance in previous Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championships would be a good starting point. If Poland has a history of winning or consistently placing high in the tournament, this would increase their chances of winning in 2024. 2. Competition Strength: The overall strength of the competition also plays a crucial role. If the 2024 championship is expected to have a particularly strong lineup of teams, this could reduce Poland's chances of winning, even if they have performed well in the past. 3. Team Changes and Preparation: Any recent changes to Poland's team, such as new players or a different team captain, could impact their performance. Additionally, their preparation for the tournament, including practice and strategy development, is crucial. 4. Game Meta Changes: Changes to the Warhammer 40,000 game meta, such as new rule sets or updates to the game's balance, can significantly affect team strategies and performance. Teams that adapt well to these changes are more likely to succeed. Without specific information on these factors, it's challenging to provide a precise probability. However, considering the general competitiveness of such tournaments and assuming Poland has a solid team with good past performance, a moderate estimate would place their chances of winning above a random guess but not at a certainty.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.background_info:
[Gold medal wins at the Summer Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All-time_Olympic_Games_medal_table) are concentrated in a small number of countries; the United States alone has won nearly 20% of every gold medal ever awarded, and a total of eight countries account for the majority of medalists.

Conversely, prior to the opening of the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, there are over 100 National Olympic Committees that have never won a gold medal. In recent Games, the number of countries that won their first gold were:

* London 2012: 3
* Rio de Janeiro 2016: 9
* Tokyo 2020: 3

Will this number be 5 or more this year?

metadata.chain_of_thought: Considering the favorable conditions provided by new sports, globalization, and historical precedents, but also acknowledging the specificity of the number requested, the probability leans towards being somewhat likely but with a cautious approach due to the specific target of at least 5 countries.

question.title: Will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

metadata.background_info:
On July 28, Venezuela held Presidential elections, but full results have not yet been published by the [National Electoral Council (CNE)](https://www.cne.gob.ve/) as of August 2. Hours after polling stations closed, the head of the CNE proclaimed the incumbent, Nicolás Maduro, the winner for a third term.

The opposition and the international community have pointed out irregularities. The CNE [asserted](https://mincyt.gob.ve/nicolas-maduro-gana-las-elecciones-presidenciales/), with 20% of ballots left to count, that Maduro's 7-point lead over the united opposition candidate Edmundo González was "irreversible", which is contradictory – by the CNE's own assertion, there were enough votes left to be counted that González could still take the lead.

Furthermore, the data published by the CNE reports no more than three numbers: the votes for Maduro (51.2% of the total), the ones for González (44.2%), and an aggregated figure for "others" (4.6%). [Analyses of the data](https://elpais.com/america/2024-08-02/quien-gano-en-venezuela-los-datos-de-la-oposicion-son-mas-verificables-que-los-oficiales.html) show that the numbers correspond *exactly* to those percentages, a result consistent with the percentages being made up and the corresponding vote counts being calculated back from them.

Meanwhile, civil society in the country has been performing an [independent, bottom-up verification of the results](https://resultadosconvzla.com/); reports generated immediately after the election by the voting machines in precincts around the country are digitized and posted online. Aggregation of these vote counts show a 37-point victory for González over Maduro.

How will the Chavista president respond? Will he publish a full, disaggregated count of the results?

metadata.chain_of_thought: Considering Venezuela's history of electoral controversies, the current polarized political climate, potential logistical challenges, and the impact of international pressure, there's a basis for skepticism about the timely release of full election results. However, without up-to-date information on the specific circumstances surrounding the July 28, 2024 election, this assessment is cautious.

metadata.background_info:
The 2024 Olympic Games is a sporting competition which takes place every four years. It involves a range of different events across multiple sports.

At the Olympic Games, Gold, Silver and Bronze medals are awarded to 1st, 2nd and 3rd place in each event. (In some events two Bronze medals are awarded mostly combat sports).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of the USA winning more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, let's consider historical data and current trends in Olympic performances. Historically, the United States has been one of the top-performing countries at the Olympics, often winning the most overall medals and frequently leading in both Gold and Silver medal counts. However, the specific outcome of winning more Gold than Silver medals can vary from one Olympics to another due to numerous factors such as changes in team composition, new sports or events being added, and varying levels of competition from other countries. One way to approach this question is to look at the United States' performance in recent Olympics. At the 2020 Tokyo Olympics, for example, the USA won 113 medals, with 39 of them being Gold and 41 Silver. This outcome shows that the margin between Gold and Silver medals can be quite narrow. Given the uncertainty in predicting the exact distribution of medals and the inherent randomness in sports competitions, predicting the USA will win more Gold than Silver medals involves some degree of speculation. However, considering the USA's consistent strong performance and the assumption that the team's preparation and competitiveness remain at a high level, it's reasonable to believe that they could win more Gold than Silver medals. But, because the difference between Gold and Silver medals is often small and subject to a high degree of variability, and without specific data on the current team's strengths and the competition landscape, it's challenging to assign a high probability to this outcome. Therefore, while there is a basis to believe the USA could perform well and potentially win more Gold than Silver medals, the uncertainty and variability in outcomes suggest a cautious approach to estimating this probability.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?

The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

content.text: Politico reports:

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, let's consider the factors that could lead to President Biden not remaining in office through the end of July 2024. 1. Resignation: There has been no official indication from President Biden or the White House that he intends to resign. While there have been various controversies and criticisms during his presidency, there's no concrete evidence to suggest he plans to step down. 2. Health Issues: President Biden's health has been a subject of public interest, but as of the latest available information, he has not announced any severe health issues that would force him to relinquish his duties as President permanently. 3. Impeachment and Removal: The process of impeachment and removal from office is lengthy and requires a significant amount of time and bipartisan support. Given the current political climate and the timeline before the end of July 2024, this seems highly improbable. 4. Death: Unfortunately, predicting someone's passing is impossible without specific information about a severe health condition. As of the last public update, there was no such indication regarding President Biden. 5. Temporary Transfer of Power under the 25th Amendment: The prompt explicitly states that a temporary transfer of power does not cause a NO resolution. Therefore, even if President Biden temporarily transfers power to his Vice President, this would not impact the resolution of the question. Given these considerations, and without any unforeseen circumstances, it's reasonable to conclude that President Biden will likely remain in office through the end of July 2024.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.
Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, let's break down the conditions required for it to resolve YES. Firstly, Joe Biden must announce that he is dropping out of the presidential race, meaning he will not seek re-election. Secondly, he must also announce his resignation from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. It's crucial to note that the actual resignation doesn't have to occur before the end of July; an announcement of his intention to resign is sufficient. Given these conditions, let's assess the likelihood. Joe Biden's decision to run for re-election or resign would be influenced by various factors, including his health, public opinion, the state of the economy, and the political landscape. However, without specific information indicating otherwise, it's reasonable to assume that a sitting president, especially one who has been in public service for as long as Joe Biden, would not make such significant decisions lightly or suddenly unless under extraordinary circumstances. Historically, U.S. presidents rarely resign, with Richard Nixon being the most notable exception due to the Watergate scandal. While Joe Biden has faced challenges during his presidency, there's no current indication of a scandal or issue severe enough to prompt a resignation announcement before the end of July 2024. Moreover, the Democratic Party's dynamics and the process of selecting a presidential candidate also suggest that sudden, drastic changes are unlikely without a compelling reason. The party would need time to adjust and prepare another candidate for the election, making a sudden resignation and withdrawal from the race before the end of July even less likely. Considering these factors, the probability that Joe Biden announces both his withdrawal from the presidential race and his resignation from office before the end of July 2024 is low.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, let's consider the context and the patterns observed in previous U.S. presidential election cycles, particularly focusing on the Democratic Party's nomination process. Firstly, the 2024 Democratic National Convention, where the party's nominee for the presidential election will be officially selected, is crucial. Before this event, it's common for potential nominees to engage in debates to present their policies, visions, and leadership qualities to the public and party members. These debates are significant in helping voters decide on their preferred candidate and in shaping the party's platform. Given the broad field of potential Democratic nominees, including figures like Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, and the incumbent President Biden, there is a clear diversity of opinion and policy approaches within the party. This diversity often leads to lively debates as candidates seek to differentiate themselves and win over supporters. Historically, debates have been a staple of the nomination process for both major parties in the United States. They are seen as essential for democratic transparency, allowing candidates to be scrutinized by the public and the press. The Democratic Party, in particular, has used debates as a platform to showcase its candidates' ideas on various issues, from healthcare and the economy to climate change and social justice. Considering these factors, it is reasonable to expect that there will be at least one more Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Such debates would provide a necessary platform for candidates to articulate their positions and for voters to make informed decisions about who should lead the party into the 2024 presidential election.

question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Uruguay rotate four or more starters (from the Panama match) in their Copa America match against the US?

content.text: Resolves YES if four or more players who started against Panama do not start against the US.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To determine the probability of Uruguay rotating four or more starters from the Panama match in their Copa America match against the US, let's consider the context and common practices in football, especially in tournament settings like the Copa America. 1. Tournament Strategy: In major tournaments, teams often aim to maintain consistency in their lineup, especially if they've found a winning formula. However, the need to rest players, especially key ones, to avoid fatigue and injuries is also crucial, especially in the group stages where teams might feel they can afford to make changes without risking their chances of advancing. 2. Opponent Consideration: The perceived strength of the opponent can also influence lineup decisions. Against stronger teams, managers might opt for what they believe is their strongest lineup, while against weaker teams, they might see an opportunity to give some players a rest. 3. Uruguay's Position and Strategy: Without knowing the exact situation of Uruguay's standings in the group at the time of the match against the US, it's difficult to pinpoint their strategy. However, if they are in a comfortable position, they might choose to rest players. If the match is crucial for their advancement, they might stick with a more consistent lineup. 4. Player Availability and Fitness: The fitness level of players after the Panama match and any injuries sustained could also significantly influence the lineup against the US. If several key players are nursing injuries or are deemed at risk of injury due to fatigue, Uruguay might be forced to make changes. 5. Recent Trends and Managerial Preferences: The managerial style of Uruguay's coach and any trends observed in their previous matches could also provide clues. Some managers prefer a more consistent lineup, while others are more willing to make changes based on the opponent and player condition. Given these considerations, without specific information on Uruguay's situation in the tournament, player fitness, and the managerial approach, it's challenging to provide a precise probability. However, it's common for teams to make some changes in their lineup during tournament group stages, especially considering the need to balance player rest with strategic considerations.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
question.body:
This will resolve YES if Disney announces that they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

To be considered a new version of the Peoplemover, this attraction would need to be a ride that has portions with views above Tomorrowland AND has at least two of the following characteristics:

1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name

2) uses existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride

3) rebuilds portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment for the new ride

4) has a station in the old peoplemover station building

5) rebuilds the old peoplemover station with approximately similar characteristics and location 

This can resolve to YES if a new ride was announced that uses portions of the Peoplemover track and station as a part of an Incredibles ride, but would resolve to NO if an attraction called Peoplemover was announced that took place entirely inside of a show building, offering no aerial views of Tomorrowland.
